meanings.definition: A system of religious worship or ritual.
meanings.sent1: The small village had a unique cultus that involved dancing around a sacred fire.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization's cultus included offerings to their gods at sunrise.
meanings.sent3: The cultus of the local tribe involved wearing feathers on their heads during ceremonies.
meanings.sent4: Her daily cultus of lighting incense and chanting brought her peace and serenity.
meanings.sent5: The cultus of the temple was so elaborate that it mesmerized all who witnessed it.

meanings.definition: A particular form or system of religious worship.
meanings.sent1: The cultus of the nomadic tribe involved singing hymns under the stars.
meanings.sent2: The cultus of the monastery included daily prayers and fasting.
meanings.sent3: The cultus of the ancient civilization required offerings of fruits and grains.
meanings.sent4: The cultus of the temple was as intricate as a spider's web.
meanings.sent5: The cultus of the forest dwellers was simple yet deeply spiritual.

meanings.definition: Devotion to a particular person or thing.
meanings.sent1: Her cultus for her favorite author led her to collect all his books.
meanings.sent2: The cultus of the fans for the rock band was evident in their enthusiastic cheers.
meanings.sent3: His cultus for vintage cars made his garage look like a museum.
meanings.sent4: Her cultus for gardening was like a blooming flower in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The cultus of the students for their teacher was heartwarming to witness.
